alert.note: Alert for Chester; Delaware; Montgomery; Philadelphia (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 09 at 5:31PM EDT until July 09 at 9:30PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Chester County in southeastern Pennsylvania... Delaware County in southeastern Pennsylvania... Southeastern Montgomery County in southeastern Pennsylvania... Philadelphia County in southeastern Pennsylvania... * Until 930 PM EDT. * At 531 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas. * Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Philadelphia, Camden, Chester, Yeadon, Westtown, Conshohocken, Hatboro, Folcroft, Ambler, Swarthmore, Paulsboro, and Jenkintown. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 334 and 346. Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 33. Interstate 76 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 333 and 351. Interstate 676 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 1. Interstate 476 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 6...and between mile markers 18 and 19. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
